ohha.domain

Class ExperimentInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohha.domain.ExperimentInfo

  • public class ExperimentInfo
extends Object
    This class holds the specifications of a single experiment; the conditions, responses and how correct responses are mapped (using ResponseMapping class).
    Author:
    Mikko Tiainen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Initialize a new ExperimentInfo with given values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExperimentInfo

        public ExperimentInfo(String name,
                      List<String> conditions,
                      List<String> responseCodes,
                      List<String> responseNames,
                      List<ResponseMapping> responseMappings)
        Initialize a new ExperimentInfo with given values.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Experiment.
        conditions - List of conditions in the Experiment.
        responseCodes - List of response codes.
        responseNames - List of response names.
        responseMappings - List of Response mappings in the Experiment.

      • ExperimentInfo

        public ExperimentInfo()
        Initialize a new ExperimentInfo with no values.

        public void setName(String name)

        public List<String> getResponseNames()

      • setResponseNames

        public void setResponseNames(List<String> responseNames)

      • getResponseNameForCode

        public String getResponseNameForCode(String code)
        Returns the name of the response based on its code. If the name for the code does not exist, returns the code itself. If the code is wrong, returns "invalid code".
        Parameters:
        code - code of the response option.
        Returns:
        name of the response with the given code.

      • getConditionMapping

        public ResponseMapping getConditionMapping(String condition)
        Returns the response mapping of a given condition.
        Parameters:
        condition - name of the condition for which the ResponseMapping is wanted for.
        Returns:
        ResponseMapping object for the given condition or null if one is not found.

      • getResponseMappings

        public List<ResponseMapping> getResponseMappings()

      • setResponseMappings

        public void setResponseMappings(List<ResponseMapping> responseMappings)

      • addResponseMapping

        public boolean addResponseMapping(ResponseMapping mapping)
        Add a new ResponseMapping object to the Experiment. Checks if a similar mapping has already been declared.
        Parameters:
        mapping - Mapping to be added.
        Returns:
        true if the mapping was successfully added.

      • getNumOfResponsesForCond

        public int getNumOfResponsesForCond(String cond)
        Get the number of responses set for a given condition.
        Parameters:
        cond - condition to get the number of responses for.
        Returns:
        number of responses wanted.

      • setCorrectResponses

        public void setCorrectResponses(String cond,
                                List<List<String>> correctResponses)
        Set correct responses for a given condition. This method skips the need to manually retrieve the specific ResponseMapping before setting the correct responses.
        Parameters:
        cond - Condition that the correct responses are for.
        correctResponses - List of lists of correct responses.

      • setSimpleCorrectResponses

        public void setSimpleCorrectResponses(String cond,
                                      List<String> correctResponses)
        If a condition has only one response, the correct responses can be given as a single list.
        Parameters:
        cond - condition for the responses.
        correctResponses - correct responses for the condition.

      • isCorrect

        public boolean isCorrect(String cond,
                         String respCode,
                         int nResp)
        Check whether a given response to a given condition is correct. This method utilizes the ResponseMapping-class to check for the correct response. Note that this overloaded version of the method only checks the correctness of the nResp response.
        Parameters:
        cond - condition of the response.
        respCode - code of the response.
        nResp - number of response which correctness is checked.
        Returns:
        true if correct.

      • isCorrect

        public boolean isCorrect(String cond,
                         List<String> respCodes)
        Checks if a response is correct. Skips have to call for the specific ResponseMapping. Checks the correctness of all given responses.
        Parameters:
        cond - Condition.
        respCodes - Response codes for the condition.
        Returns:
        True if all responses are correct, otherwise false.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
